body_html:
We should deprecate torch.Tensor before the next major release, right?

Okay, thanks, good to know. Is there an alternative copy-free-if-possible way to make a tensor from some data? I'm thinking of something like numpy.asarray. It's pretty common that you would like to make sure the thing you're working with is a tensor, but you don't want an unnecessary copy.
body_text:
We should deprecate torch.Tensor before the next major release, right?

Okay, thanks, good to know. Is there an alternative copy-free-if-possible way to make a tensor from some data? I'm thinking of something like numpy.asarray. It's pretty common that you would like to make sure the thing you're working with is a tensor, but you don't want an unnecessary copy.
body:
> We should deprecate torch.Tensor before the next major release, right?

Okay, thanks, good to know. Is there an alternative copy-free-if-possible way to make a tensor from some data? I'm thinking of something like `numpy.asarray`. It's pretty common that you would like to make sure the thing you're working with is a tensor, but you don't want an unnecessary copy.
